alert.note: Alert for Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 5:43PM CST until February 22 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph with significantly reduced visibility along with extremely difficult travel. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. * WHERE...In North Dakota, Cass County. In Minnesota, Clay County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 9 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 9 PM this evening to noon CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce the visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Avoid outside activities if possible. If outside, make sure you wear appropriate winter clothing. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
